intro: Gymnosporia ambonensis, commonly known as the Madagascar thornapple, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves, and it produces yellow flowers that develop into fleshy, orange fruits. Gymnosporia ambonensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry forests and scrublands. Its fruits are edible when ripe but contain seeds that are dispersed by animals.
